alert.note: Alert for Central Horry; Inland Georgetown; Marion; Williamsburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 07 at 3:29PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Georgetown, southwestern Horry, south central Marion and east central Williamsburg Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 329 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rhems, or 17 miles northwest of Georgetown, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Socastee, Dongola, Rhems, Outland, Warsaw, Yauhannah, Bucksville, Pee Dee Crossroads, Morrisville and Bucksport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for northeastern South Carolina.

area.areaDesc: Central Horry; Inland Georgetown; Marion; Williamsburg
